He’d rather gosledding with a little kid his own age. Simon is bugged and starts looking for someone to play with. He meets up with Emy, a big girl, who agrees to sled with him even though she thinks he’s kind of young!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an Atlantic puffin in the garden while playing with his remote-controlled car. The Junior Rangers decide to take the puffin home to Iceland. There, Leo has a mishap at the edge of a cliff.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson has one hour to use the camera car to take pictures of three faults: one that’s up high, one that’s down low, and one that’s on something moving. Wilson spots a fault on something moving - Koko’s wagon - and wastes most of his time chasing her without ever getting a picture. Time’s up and Wilson thinks he’s failed his badge, as he’s only photographed two faults: a fallen signpost and faulty doors on a chute at the quarry. But Lori points out that not only is the chute is high up, but also its doors move – so that counts as two things and Wilson wins his badge!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn a passenger service badge, Wilson must speak up, be nice to his passengers, and smile at all times – no matter what happens! His passengers know that it’s a test, and go out of their way to make things very challenging for Wilson - but he keeps smiling and earns his badge.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina are very excited today as Mom and Dad have organized a treasure hunt for them in the forest! Tchoupi is very confident he’ll find the treasure in no time as he and Nina have prepared for it. As they move from clue to clue, the two friends have fun discovering other aspects of the forest, but Tchoupi starts to get impatient: why’s it taking so long to find the treasure??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! They manage to track her down, nestling nice and cozy inside Loupiote the dog’s kennel, of all places! She’s come here to lay her eggs and she intends to stay! T’choupi and Nina try to coax her out with various treats… in vain. The problem is, Loupiote is out of a home right now!... But what if they were to find her another kennel??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi gets a surprise when he finds out there’s a second donkey in the hamlet - a female donkey by the name of Cuddles. He and she hit it off immediately, so when Benedicte suggests they take the two donkeys for a walk in the forest, T’choupi and Nina are overjoyed! Only problem is, T’choupi pampers Cuddles so much that she keeps refusing to budge throughout the whole walk: she’d rather stop and chew on the “treats” along the way!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Say Papi, were there dinosaurs when you were little? asks Charley to his grandfather. All his friends would love to know the answer too. So Anna decides to invite Grandpa, who is a big fan of dinosaurs, to run a workshop on the subject. The big day arrives and Grandpa brings a cardboard box to school... and it starts to move! What if there was a real baby dinosaur inside?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: For the Great Neighborhood feast, each resident brings a square that best represents him or her, and that will join the big patchwork of the year. Sam help Julia to make her own square in time.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia got bored. GrandMa lend them a long knitting needle that is supposed to indicate them the direction of great things to do. It seems it works, but is the needle really a magical one?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sonny is trying to prove himself to be a useful engine so that he can stay working on Sodor, but nobody seems to trust him... nobody apart from Diesel, that is! But can Diesel be trusted?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps Ruth fix up an old windmill into her new, energy-efficient workshop.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the theme part and rides his first rollercoaster!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Leo make an erupting volcano for the science fair!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. Huckle and his team search for clues at all the places Sadie visited that day. They discover the dolly inside a grand piano thats playing a few sour notes./Cars are disappearing from a particular parking space, Huckle and gang set out to find out why.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Gorilla shows Monkey and the children how to squat down with clenched fists, walk on four using their fists and beat their chest while crying out like a Gorilla’s.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: While trying to win a big snowbowling tournament, Monkey discovers that one of his bowling pins is a penguin! A penguin is perfect for Monkey’s favorite game….. Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman, Mandy, Sarah and James are participating in Mooses Wild West Experience. But after a bumbling cowboy show from Elvis and Steele, and a cattle drive consisting of sleeping animals the children are less than impressed.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sam rescues a cat from a drain. Hannah Mandy and Norman look after it. But when the cat won’t let them watch a movie in peace Norman lets it out with CATastrophic consequences!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin and Rabbit are so intent on finding a super rare meteorite on a Nature Nuts Hike that they almost miss out on all the other amazing everyday things all around them, right there in the Woodland forest. / Franklin insists on playing the Knight over and over again in his and his friends’ make-believe game. Only when Beaver points out this is unfair and he is finally forced to play the role of the dreaded dragon does he learn that, when you are open to it, there is fun to be found in unexpected places.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: For her dads birthday, Biva has made a beautiful model of their beavers hut. She asks Rosie to keep it and take care of it until the next day. Rosie promises she will, but fails to keep track of it, as Berry takes it to play outside… When the little vixen realizes what happened, its too late: a crow has stolen twigs from the model and destroyed it… Rosie is crestfallen: what will her best friend say?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to go outside to fly his kite but it is impossible because there is not enough wind. Doodleboo suggests going to the park instead because he knows a very fun activity. What is it?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Help! Sketcky does not have a costume idea for the island party tomorrow. Fortunately, Bubble has a great idea that will make everyone laugh.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky wanted to make sandcastles at the beach, but it started to rain! Doodleboo will give him a good idea to keep himself busy without having to cope with the rain.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave cheer Little Lamb on in her first big running race. Little Lamb doesn’t think she’s good enough to beat the champion, Speedy Sheep, so they make up a rousing cheerleader chant to encourage her to run faster. They even add some special moves! But will this be enough to help Little Lamb become the new speedy champion?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave build a playhouse for Little Lamb, Baby Calf and Littlest Bunny. First they choose a safe place to build. Then they work out which construction materials to use to create a strong, weatherproof, perfectly sized playhouse that all three friends can play in together.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its a windy day, and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s bath time and Bing just can’t help adding a few more quirts of bubble goo…and a few more….and a few more, until he gets more bubbles than he can handle.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula who is engrossed in a game of ‘sparkle magic’ when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula finds all sorts of reasons why Bing can’t play with her special sparkly things. Amma suggests that Bing makes his own sparkle magic stone but disaster strikes when Bing accidentally spills Sula’s precious sparkle dust.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to dig the biggest hole and gets upset when Pando accidentally fills it in.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Someone in Busytown Park got rid of Sally and Hildas newly drawn hopscotch board. Huckle and Lowly set about helping the girls find out whos responsible. As it turns out the culprit isnt a who, but a what - the parks new sprinkler system washed the chalk drawing clean off the sidewalk./ Mr. Gronkle’s great great grandfather has hidden a priceless treasure somewhere and it’s up to Huckle and the gang to find it.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is playing basketball but each time he tries to dunk, the coconut flies off and hits poor Parrot...Mole appears and tells them dolphins are known for their ability to leap high into the air... off they go in search for dolphin in the sea, when they see dolphin dives in they follow. They invite dolphin to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Hannah, James, Mandy, Sarah and Norman have been using Joe’s Growmaster 2000 to produce their giant Pumpkin. James, pulling the pumpkin balanced carefully across four Go-Karts, heads downhill. The Go Karts, and James go flying down towards the park. Sam must rescue James as the Go-Kart is heading straight for the cliffs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy needs more bees! When Mandy competes with James to attract more bee visitors to her Bee Hotel, she knocks over Malcom’s smoker and starts a fire! The Firefighters rush to put out the fire AND save the bees.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate and her stuffed toy friends use their imaginations to go on wild and incredible adventures.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: When Dad catches a cold, Kate wants to help him feel better. In Mimiloo, Gobble and Tack have caught a bug too…the giggle bugs! Kate and Mim-Mim must find the cure: merry berry bush berries. The bush will only release berries if they make it laugh, but Mim-Mim’s jokes aren’t funny. He’ll have to tickle its funny bone another way!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Luce are awe - struck when they find out that Ciboulette the cat has just had kittens! Dad asks them to leave the babies alone as they need peace and quiet in order to grow. But the two friends go to see Ciboulette and her adorable kittens over and over, behind Dad’s back. Until… all the cats go missing!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina and her father, who are preparing a delicious dessert with yummy blackberries from the woods, Tchoupi wants to make his own recipe from a forest ingredient. Easier said than done: chestnuts or mushrooms aren’t always easy to find… especially when there’s a greedy squirrel roaming nearby!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have planned to play in their lair but Tonio wants to find out where it is! Noit so easy to fool him. But what if this game turns out to be even more fun than the one originally planned?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: In the courtyard, Sam and Julia have discovered that snowflakes are formed by beautiful little stars. But how can they preserve these wonders and show them to Julias mom before it melt?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Frogs are staying at the Guesthouse Appleseed to collect leaves. When Tilda discovers a beautiful portrait of herself, she asks Rupert, who also received a portrait, and they search for the artist.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Today, the Triplets feel like playing pirates and Nini would love to play along. Oh no! She’s too young to play pirates with us ! However, Nini has a solid argument: a treasure! Quick, the Triplets and Nini run to the park to protect and bury it. But when Mrs Bun cannot find her jewelry, all eyes turn to Nini who confesses she put them in her treasure box. Good thing the kids drew a map leading to the treasure. Now all they have to do is: Decipher it!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom has invited friends over for dinner tonight. The Triplets have to finish eating before they arrive: it is a dinner for grownups only! Too bad, they will not be able to taste the delicious meal Mom has prepared. But Mom tells them that the dinner would be extremely boring for them, so no need to be disappointed. Ding Dong! The doorbell rings! « Sorry, the dinner is not tonight! », Girl tells the guests. That way Mom won’t have to spend a boring evening with them either.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: After spending the day with Rosie, Basil walks his daughter back to the burrow, but she feels that the time has flown by too fast. Trying to spend just a little more time with her dad, she invites Basil in to say hello to the rest of the family. As he has neverbeen inside the burrow, Basil hesitates… Edmund confirms Rosies invitation: Basil is very welcome inside the burrow! ToRosie and the little badgers’ great delight, Basil accepts to come in for a moment.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou visits the aquarium on a school trip and spots a seahorse, a scuba diver and a sea lion!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the lake to celebrate the Fourth of July.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia uses what she learns about lighthouses to suggest covering a big wheel in Christmas lights, so Harold can see where he is going in a storm

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Dr Ling is experimenting with a new invention that can help chuggers increase their speed - the Booster! Brewster helps her to test it. The new booster makes him go super-fast, but it has some terrible side effects. Brewster gets a lot of attention and loves being thought of as a speedy engine, so he says nothing about the problems. But when Hodge borrows the booster and ends up in danger, Brewster comes clean and figures out a way to save runaway Hodge!

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Hodge loves Chuggington Quiz Night - so when quizmaster Harrison loses his voice, Hodge volunteers to take his place. But he has a really busy workday with Eddie and doesn’t get any time to think up his questions. To try to save time, Hodge overloads himself and breaks his axle. Because Hodge is one of a kind, they won’t be able to find a replacement in time for him to host the quiz. Wilson has an idea. He and Calley go to the foundry and have one specially made. With his custom-made axle, Hodge is good as new - and he makes it to the Training Yard in time to host the best quiz night ever!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Say Papi, were there dinosaurs when you were little? asks Charley to his grandfather. All his friends would love to know the answer too. So Anna decides to invite Grandpa, who is a big fan of dinosaurs, to run a workshop on the subject. The big day arrives and Grandpa brings a cardboard box to school... and it starts to move! What if there was a real baby dinosaur inside?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have fun at the Animal Day Parade. They decorate their Rollypod trailers, transforming them into colourful floats and give some of their animal friends a lift to the parade. The parade queen is chosen and everyone ready, until Sneezy Sheep’s giant parade balloon floats away! Hatty saves the day and proudly leads them all in the parade.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Whos back can we ride on in the ocean? Doodleboo explains how to draw a sea horse

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo embarks on a challenging solo mission, The Mata-Mata Mission, to return a rehabilitated Mata-Mata turtle to its rainforest habitat in South America, struggling with a heavy trolley and realizes, he’s missing the map! In the garden, Katie surprises Leo by hiding in a pile of leaves which ends up with the leaves all messed up. Katie is about to rake them when they receive a call from Peyo. They travel to South America to assist Peyo with his mission. After considering various relocation options, they seek guidance from Ranger Joey, learning about the turtles preference for still, warm water. They accidentally push the trolley into a lake and the Mata-Mata is nowhere to be found but soon realizes that its ability to perfectly camouflage in the lake means they have found its new home. Back in the garden, Hero ambushes Katie by hiding in a pile of leaves.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night, Berry and Dolly saw a shiny thing falling from the sky. Fearfully, they head to the depths of the forest to find out what the strange light might be. They found a star-shaped house and a girl.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One day Berry and Flutter played a board game. The first round was won by Berry, and the second one was won by him as well. In the third round, Flutter finished first. Berry got very angry. They played another round, but Flutter won again. Berry couldn’t help but made a scene.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Stanley and Balthazar ruin Flutters playing cards, but seeing the butterfly girls sadness, they ask Dollys help to make a brand new card deck.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Leapy the grasshopper makes fun of Katie the yellow ladybird, because she blows bigger bubbles than her. Later, regretting her actions, Leapy has to find a way to apologize to Katie.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Dolly accidentally knocks over a glass of water on Berrys painting. The colors on Berrys painting get faint and watery. Berry gets mad at Dolly for ruining his painting. Later Berrys friends admire the little snails unique style of painting, so he insists that it was his idea to make the painting like this. But then Dolly arrives and sheds light to Berrys lies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple Dumplin comes to visit her cousin Strawberry. Soon she causes trouble: she installs a light/music display in Strawberrys bedroom, but cannot turn it off; later she causes a power failure. After Apple leaves, it is revealed that she fixed the power.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy bit off more than they can chew! They have picked so many plums that the Fox-Badger family will never be able to eat them all before they rot… Margaret asks the children to find solutions to avoid such a waste. Our three little heroes first think of giving them away to the neighbors, but there’s still plenty of plums left.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a Midsummers night, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends decide to try to stay up all night. With the beautiful long dusk there is plenty of time for play, but one by one they drop off to sleep in the wee small hours. Luckily that leaves them plenty of energy to play the next day.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers Little Field Mouse has a wonderful collection of interesting Autumn leaves and Little Grey Squirrel has a collection of acorns of all varieties, he decides to start a collection of his own. But Little Nutbrown Hare cant decide what to collect, until his father encourages him to realise that he has a wonderful collection of memories.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanley, the stag beetle, and his friends excitedly try out the new traffic park, practicing the rules of the road with roller skates, scooters, bicycles, and small motorcycles. However, Balthazar, the bee, ignores the signs and causes a minor accident by driving recklessly. With the help of the Queen Ant, the little friends learn traffic rules and signs so they can play safely and happily together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Its Ellas birthday. What can Sam and Julia give to a little mouse who already has everything in her room? After a few wanderings, they will find something that really pleases their friend.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: For the Great Neighborhood feast, each resident brings a square that best represents him or her, and that will join the big patchwork of the year. Sam help Julia to make her own square in time.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mommy is coming home! The Triplets run to welcome her when they realize her favorite flowerpot has been knocked down and broken. But who could do such a thing? The Triplets decide to hide the flowerpot but unfortunately Mommy sees it and asks to know who did this. Since no one replies, she states a fault confessed is half redressed and she gives them five minutes to find the guilty one. Who did this? Girl with her tea party? Turbulent with his soccer ball? Or Poet with his violin? Or maybe someone else?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: It’s the end of the day at the beach and the Triplets want an ice cream. Mommy says they won’t be hungry for dinner when she prepares for them a delicious soup of stinging nettles and a juicy ox tongue. When she sees their reaction, Mommy challenges them to fish their dinner and everything they’ll find will end in their plate. The Triplets are more than excited, which one of them will bring the biggest fish? But unfortunately, our heroes will only catch a disgusting, sticky jellyfish. They hope Mommy wont’ make them eat it

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Wilson looks shiny and new after his trip to the Chug Wash and the other trainees are impressed - but everyone knows hes a magnet for a mess!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Hannah, James, Mandy, Sarah and Norman have been using Joe’s Growmaster 2000 to produce their giant Pumpkin. James, pulling the pumpkin balanced carefully across four Go-Karts, heads downhill. The Go Karts, and James go flying down towards the park. Sam must rescue James as the Go-Kart is heading straight for the cliffs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy needs more bees! When Mandy competes with James to attract more bee visitors to her Bee Hotel, she knocks over Malcom’s smoker and starts a fire! The Firefighters rush to put out the fire AND save the bees.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: One of Kate’s cookies goes missing when she’s not looking! In Mimiloo, colourful things are mysteriously disappearing. Detectives Kate and Mim-Mim must follow the clues to discover the identity of the colour-loving culprit.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s nightlight isn’t working, and she’s afraid to sleep in the dark. In Mimiloo, Kate and her friends go exploring in the furthest depths of the Singing Seas. But Mim-Mim is afraid of the dark waters and the scary creatures that must live underwater, so it’s up to Kate and her friends to make him feel safe.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: In music class, Caillou tries to impress Ms. Martin by blurting out all the answers to her questions, but a rockstar fantasy teaches him that it’s better to share the spotlight with your bandmates so when it comes time for the class to play their instruments, Caillou lets his classmates shine!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: While on a long road trip to the farm, Caillou can’t help but get increasingly bored, so he pretends to be on a quest to find the cure for boredom. He travels through mystical lands and meets magical characters, and eventually discovers that the cure for boredom is his own imagination.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Daisy the railcar can carry passengers without having to pull any coaches. So, when Thomas is sent to work in the quarry for a spell and Daisy takes on his usual responsibilities, Annie and Clarabel are left behind. Daisy takes every opportunity to remind Annie and Clarabel that, as long as she is working Thomas’s branch line, they are not needed. But, when Daisy becomes popular with her passengers, she has to pull some passenger coaches after all! Annie and Clarabel get their own back by tricking Daisy into thinking she is need of repair. But two wrongs don’t make a right and Annie and Clarabel only end up being left behind in a siding… and then pulled along by dirty old Diesel! *Cough! Cough!*

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Rising temperatures have caused a lake to dry up. Its up to the Junior Rangers to find a new home for the Hippopotamus.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers have to help a lonely Proboscis Monkey find his honk again.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Everyone is decorating pumpkins but Teds giant pumpkin floats out to sea.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat and Jess must deliver an inflatable shark for Sealife Awareness Day at the school.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is on the swing in the park when Pando arrives and wants to have a go too. They agree to let each other have turns by counting up to ten, but Pando wont count properly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing and Sula feed the ducks in the park, Sula stands quietly but Bing is boisterous.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Flop water plants in the garden. Bing finds a frog and wants to keep it, so he and Sula decide to build her a little house with a bucket. Sula and Bing prepare a cozy house with food and a bed, but the frog doesnt like the new house so it hops away. Where can she be?

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie offer to pick tutti-fruits for Madame Butterfly so that she can make their favourite pie. They take little Catrina along with strict instructions not to let her spoil her appetite by eating the fruits. Once at the park, Catrina spots a mother bird struggling to feed her hungry babies and decides to help. Oswald doesn’t realise what she’s up to as he keeps being distracted by his passing friends. Thinking Catrina is trying to eat the tutti fruits herself, Oswald spills all of his fruits trying to stop her. But when he finds out what Catrina is really up to he gladly lends a hand.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry is reluctant to go to the beach with Oswald and Daisy because he hates getting wet, but Oswald eventually manages to persuade him and they all head off. Once there, Daisy starts splashing around, inadvertently scaring Henry away from the water. She decides to go surfing so she’s out of Henry’s way while he settles down to read his newspaper on his special Penguin Patrol raft. Suddenly Daisy appears riding a huge wave and heading straight for the beach – and the unsuspecting Henry! Everyone ends up in the water. Just as well, since Daisy has got stranded on a sandbar and needs rescuing.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Keen on Bob’s sardine sandwiches, Pilchard sneaks into his rucksack and hitches a ride to work at Chef Tattie’s UFO-themed revolving restaurant where she sneaks out and walks through some paint leaving a trail of green footprints. Inspired by all the talk of ‘aliens’, the Machines follow the trail. Pilchard arrives in the kitchen and goes to sleep on top of a remote control causing the restaurant to revolve at high speed. Bob saves the day by luring Pilchard off the remote control with a sardine sandwich. The team finish the restaurant and the Machines discover the truth about the ‘alien’ .

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team will be building an enclosure and viewing platform for the new giraffe. Lofty is excited that he will be seeing his favourite animal. But when the giraffe arrives he gets so anxious to get a good view that he crashes through a fence and frightens the giraffe away! Luckily he knows exactly what giraffes eat and is soon tempting the giraffe back to his enclosure with a big pile of leaves on his jib. The enclosure is finished and tidied up just in time and Bob suggests Jenny Dobbs names the giraffe after it’s biggest fan… Lofty!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Chilly Autumn winds blow as Little Nutbrown Hare chases the beautiful fallen leaves. When one wafts so high that only a bird could catch it Little Nutbrown Hare wishes he could fly as well. He and Little Field Mouse try every way they can think of to fly, without luck. They have fun trying, however, and along the way they discover they have their own very special talents.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are having a boat race and all the boats have a different sail. What colour are the sails?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is busy in his bedroom, there’s toys and clothes thrown all over the higgledy, piggledy place! He stands on the bed admiring the view – what a magnificent mess - his best ever! Suddenly the lights go out. He tries pressing the light switch on and off but he remains surrounded by darkness. “Why did my light go off all on its own?” he wonders so he vortexes himself to Okido to find out. Messy lands in Okido and bounces into Zoe and Felix’s house where he finds them dancing to disco music. “Hey! You’re having a party without me” moans Messy. Zoe reassures him that they’re only practicing for their disco later on in the day.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is happily singing away and about to eat a delicious ice cube sandwich but before he knows it, the ice has melted leaving a very sorry looking sandwich indeed! Scratching his head, he decides to find out why it’s suddenly become so warm? When you need to know... Go to Okido! Messy lands in Okido to find Zoe and Felix in their garden. They’re fanning themselves under the shade of an umbrella but can’t seem to cool down! In order to find some cool shade they ski-doodle off in Okidoodle to the Cloudship.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Raspberry and Lemon want to join a fashion contest. They offer Strawberry to be their model, but she is too busy running both her cafe and the market. Raspberry and Lemon meet the twins Sweet and Sour Grapes, whose names fit their personalities and offer them to replace Strawberry in the cafe.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and the dinos are playing a game of I Spy, Harry decides to spy his dinos, but he cant remember their proper dinosaur names.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and Charlie are arguing over what the moon is made of. In order to settle their dispute they take a rocket journey to the moon via Dino World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the wetlands of China, Kais drone, the Kaimera-1000, captures stunning footage of Red-Crowned Cranes before abruptly crashing into a crane’s nest. Faced with the challenge of retrieving the drone without disturbing the nesting crane, Leo, Katie, and Hero embark on a mission. They go on a search to find the drone via air but when they do find it, a crane sits on its nest - with the drone in it! They attempt to distract the crane using recorded calls of the crane but fail until a curious crane chick responds. Hero befriends the chick, triggering a joyful dance among the cranes. Hero howls, followed by the chick peeping, which causes the nesting crane to come and check on its baby. This allows Kai to recover his drone discreetly from the nest. Back at the treehouse, Leo questions why Hero is still howling and declares it a mystery but then his question is answered when a pair of cranes flies by.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone fears the worst when Rebecca works with the Troublesome Trucks, but she finds that the naughty trucks can be highly entertaining

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Toby does not feel useful working at Ulfstead Castle but soon proves some rude passengers wrong when he saves the crown.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: It’s circus day in Dragontown! But when Grisu comes to ask for a fightfighting job, he discovers the circus performers are not there yet to put up the big tent for the circus. So Grisu volunteers, along with Stella’s help. But it’s not easy! The sheep almost eat the directions, and the poles are heavy, and Fume gets in the way. In the meantime, Stranavoce travels across town to announce the circus, coming across the strange talents of some Dragontown residents. Just as Grisu and Stella have finished planting the poles and are ready to raise the tent, Stranavoce gets a call: Now the circus performers aren’t coming at all! Oh no!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Ratatino was supposed to be filming the very shy Leopard Monkeys for his new documentary in the jungle. But he fell at the airport and hurt his arm, so he asks Grisu to go in his place, to track and film the monkeys for him. Fume is happy to fly Grisu to the jungle as he hopes it will give him a chance to do some dragon training with his son. However, tracking the Monkey’s proves to be a very difficult task until Grisu discovers they like music and he turns Fume into a one-man jungle band as he films the Monkeys successfully.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare has a new game. He will be Big Nutbrown Hare for a day, doing jobs like finding food, answering tricky questions and resting in the grass. Likewise, Big Nutbrown Hare must take on his son’s jobs of playing with his friends, making up new games and asking questions. It’s all great fun until they realize that they are much, much better at being themselves.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko is put in charge of Wilson and Brewster. The team has to complete a newspaper round by a certain time. Koko nearly fails and learns that being bossy isn’t the best way to lead. She tries again, using her team members’ strengths instead and in the end shares her badge with Wilson and Brewster. After all – they’re a team!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Sitting at the table with her family, Rosie is talking about how she is looking forward to her wonderful holidays with her father. But the little vixen is surprised by the lack of attention of her two brothers, too busy talking about their own holidays. Soon, Rosie feels left out and is worried that the twins might forget her. To prevent this from happening, she becomes very clingy. Singing, making fishing rods, drawing… Rosie is alwaysaround. So much so that it starts to annoy her brothers.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building Spring City’s new Ice Rink when the Rockets arrive and plead with him to finish it as soon as possible. They explain that the rink they were going to be playing on that evening is out of action and they have no-where to play! Bob tells them he’ll do his best and the building begins. Muck is fascinated by the idea of Ice Hockey and when Bob and Wendy set off to get the clear plastic panels to fit in the barrier surrounds, Muck decides to have a little go himself. Despite Leo’s protestations, all the machines are soon skidding about on the ice causing mayhem! When Bob and Wendy arrive back, they are alarmed to see all the barriers knocked down! Muck says sorry but Bob knows that the Rockets will be back very soon and they need to work fast.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new extension to the Spring City Museum. They are awaiting the delivery of its first exhibit – a full sized Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton. Mr. Bentley has come out in his lunch break to supervise the arrival of the skeleton. But while Bob is back at his yard Leo discovers to his horror that Mr. Bentley has bungled the dimensions of the doors to the new extension, and now they are unable to get the huge dinosaur skeleton inside. Lofty suggests taking the skeleton to pieces and reassembling the bones inside the building.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers that a satin bowerbird has been stealing blue objects from him and his family. Realising that the satin bowerbird might be lost, the Junior Rangers set out to bring the satin bowerbird back to its bower.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Today’s mission: return a white-bellied woodpecker to its rightful place in the rainforest! The Junior Rangers try to do just that, but come under attack by a swarm of wasps. Will the Junior Rangers succeed in their mission, or face the sting of defeat?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are super impatient to go pick up the newspaper in the village with Grandpa. That’s because they are going to be able to sit in the motorcycle side-car. Awwwwesome! And especially because they are also going to be able to buy candy. What could be cooler?! Unfortunately, the side-car stalls on their way into town. What are they going to do? Well, to begin with, they are going to call the mechanic. No, but what are they going to do about the candy??!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its a windy day, and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda breaks a teacup right after getting up, for Molly theres only one explanation: its Friday the 13th. At first, Tilda dismisses this as pure superstition. After several further mishaps, however, she begins to worry that maybe there is something to it. Her friends are absolutely convinced.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda dreams of learning to fly. Excited by Robin Robins statement that anyone with wings can fly, Tilda makes herself some from lettuce leaves. Robin is supposed to give her flying instruction, but she gets bored with all the tedious theory. Molly gets Rupert to help persuade Tilda flying is a bad idea.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, Tilda opens her front door and cant believe her eyes: theres an egg in her front garden. While Tilda asks Robin Robin for tips on egg care, Molly distributes flyers in Wild Rose Lane to find the owner. After a while, the egg cracks open and a chick hatches. As at that moment Tilda is not at home, the chick thinks Molly is its mother.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: When Simon and Ferdinand see Mommy and Daddy playing badminton, they want to try too: playing with rackets looks like a cinch! Except that no, it’s super hard to hit the birdie with these big rackets. They aren’t able to have one single volley. Simon is determined though, yes, they are going to do it! But it will have to wait until after lunch because Daddy has just called them to table. During the meal, Gaspard, but not on purpose, pops off the top of his apple sauce and Simon’s immediate reflex is to hit it in mid-air with his big spoon. Yes, he did it!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: After an Asian palm civet steals Hero’s food, the Junior Rangers set off to bring the civet back to where it belongs. The trip takes them to the rainforest, a durian plantation and a run-in with a wild boar!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot must decide the best order in which to do three jobs: pick up the Mayor, clean the tunnel with the scrub-a-chug and have a chugwash. Deciding they should look their best for the Mayor, they have a chugwash first. Then they clean the tunnels – which gets them filthy again! They’re afraid they won’t earn their badges – until they use the scrub-a-chug to clean themselves. Now sparkling, they pick up the Mayor and Vee awards them their badges!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot must make deliveries through the night, finishing before sunrise. Away from Chuggington, when Hoot’s light fails, he screeches to a halt and is too scared to move! But with some gentle encouragement and clever shadow play from Toot, Hoot realises how much fun the night time can be. All their jobs get done before sunrise, and the twins win their badges

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is feeling a bit grumpy. He’s even refusing to play with Nina: our little hero is missing his grandparents and friends back home. But Mom reassures him: it’s normal to sometimes feel a little down when you’re away your loved - ones. To cheer him up, Dad suggests they make changes to the cottage, to remind him of his house back home, and his family! Tchoupi suddenly switches from feeling sad to feeling ecstatic! He’s eager to invite Nina to celebrate this happy day with him… but can’t find her anywhere! This gets him worrying: what if his friend took off because of how unkind he was to her this morning?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and his family arrive at the hamlet for their first day of vacation. Having been told by his parents that their stay will be packed with surprises, T’choupi has high expectations! But disappointment sets in fast: not only does he find the dog daunting, he also notices there’s no slide, or TV, or pool! This place is going to be sooo boring!!... Until he finds out there’s a girl his age living there. Huh, where?! T’choupi can’t wait to meet this mysterious potential playmate!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Dad sends Tchoupi and Nina out on a mission: to go to the vegetable garden and find the veggies he needs to make a nice mixed salad! The kids are delighted… until they discover that the tomatoes - the main ingredient for Dad’s salad - are green instead of red! Nina comes up with a solution she heard about from her mom: music!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley just doesnt get it: everyone accuses him of things hes never done! Until he discovers a little boy on the sports course who looks a lot like him and is a real scoundrel. So hes the one doing the mischief, not Charley! But how do you tell the little rascal to behave?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam got a wrong idea about what Julias life was like when she lived on her island. Julia try to show Sam by immersing him in a tropical atmosphere, reconstituted at the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To participate at the annual cheese hunt with the other children of the residence, Julia faces a problem : she has a cold and cant sniff anything. Sam is going to help her to play with them anyway!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Rickety Old Bridge collapses, trapping Toby and Henrietta on the other side of the ravine, Inventor Ruth is asked to build a new one.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the water park and faces pirates, races down lazy river, and rides a big slide!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets stung by a bee, but learns that bees are special creatures that dont want to hurt people!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is expecting a visit from his friend Frog; in the meantime he practices his leapfrog abilities. When Frog finally arrives Monkey has an even better idea, that they play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey thinks he’s got a scary roar although the fly that’s bothering him doesn’t seem to think so. Hearing his friend Lion, Monkey realizes that he needs to learn how to roar properly. With the ‘King of the jungle’s’ help Monkey plays his favorite game… Monkey see Monkey do!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: With the cadets stoked to take a helicopter ride on Wallaby 2, Sam and Elvis must pull a high-flying rescue when a scary incident occurs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: It’s fright night for Norman after he watches a scary movie, but his panic leaves him thinking everyone is turning into Pontypandy Zombies… Pondies. He tries to signal for help but ends up trapped in a burning building. The Fire Team are called to the rescue.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin is nervous about finding his own special beat to play at Aunt T’s Drum Circle. Only when he stops and listens does he find a beat unique to himself – his heartbeat. /Franklin enlists the help of all his friends to make a cardboard play plane but then alienates them all when he won’t let anyone else be pilot. Only after he’s left to play on his own does he finally realize that the plane should really belong to all of them -- and it’s much more fun to share!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: After spending the day with Rosie, Basil walks his daughter back to the burrow, but she feels that the time has flown by too fast. Trying to spend just a little more time with her dad, she invites Basil in to say hello to the rest of the family. As he has neverbeen inside the burrow, Basil hesitates… Edmund confirms Rosies invitation: Basil is very welcome inside the burrow! ToRosie and the little badgers’ great delight, Basil accepts to come in for a moment.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: It’s so hot! cries Sketcky! What is better than a Riddleboo to know how to get refreshed?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is thrilled to have plenty of treats for the upcoming Halloween and hopes to have more than the year before. But how to do it? Doodleboo has an idea: he knows what makes it possible to collect even more candy on Halloween!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky wonders about the island in the distance. He would like to see it more closely, but how? Fortunately, Doodleboo has the solution.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave go in search of Littlest Bunny’s missing cuddly carrot toy. They search all the places that Little Bunny has played that day, one by one, without success. It’s only when they have learned to look carefully and check big open spaces thoroughly, by walking slowly in lines from one side to the other, that they find it. They also find Penny Hen’s lost scarf, Herman the Hermit Crab’s beach bucket and Cindy Squirrel’s missing nuts!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have fun at the Animal Day Parade. They decorate their Rollypod trailers, transforming them into colourful floats and give some of their animal friends a lift to the parade. The parade queen is chosen and everyone ready, until Sneezy Sheep’s giant parade balloon floats away! Hatty saves the day and proudly leads them all in the parade.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one – match! At first it’s fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey wants to dress up as something special no one has ever seen before... Mole then appears and tells them about how birds of paradise are known as being unique. When they arrive at the forest, they meet Bird of paradise. They learn about finding their unique look and grove, and Monkey invites Bird of paradise to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At the garage, Joe, Hannah, and James try to point a giant laser beam at the moon to measure how far away it is. Norman worries they’ll lead Moon Men down to Pontypandy, putting everyone in danger… but it’s his panic that ends up causing a fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! Her dad upgrades her scooter, and she speeds through her deliveries… until she hits a bump, loses her brakes, and needs to be rescued before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wonders what’s wrong with her birdhouse— the birds aren’t visiting it. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends offer to babysit a shape-changing baby squoosh so its mama squoosh can focus on building a nest. But getting the squoosh to nap and eat is harder than it sounds!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s sad because her snowman is melting! In Mimiloo, it’s a sweltering hot day so Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends head to the Winter Waterfalls to cool down—only to find that all the ice is melting! To re-freeze the waterfalls, Kate will have to find Chilly, the snowman who keeps the Winter Waterfalls cold, snowy and frozen.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is pretending to Nina that he’s able to read… but loses track of the story he’s trying to tell. An idea suddenly springs to mind: why doesn’t he just make up the rest of the story, in real life?!... The only thing they need to make it complete is a little chick to play the hero of their adventure. But when catching it turns out to be a lot more difficult than they’d bargained for, they realize they may just be living the true adventure, in real time…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina’s drawing of a rainbow, Tchoupi lists out all the colors within it. When he gets it wrong, Nina suggests they turn it into a game and look for the various hues in Nature. Loving the idea, Mom suggests they go find the colors on the flowers and vegetables in the hamlet. Nina and Tchoupi come back in next to no time, mission accomplished! Recognizing their talent, Dad ups the stakes, setting them the challenge of spotting the rainbow colors… among the animals! Mmm, easier said than done…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Which child will get the big spoon for the annual fondue held in memory of the very first residents of th Mouse Mansion. Sam and Julia are in competition, will their friendship hold up?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: The big neighbourhood race is coming up, and Snaily, who came in last place last year, dreams of winning this time. He discovers his talent on Billys skateboard, but the rules stand in his way.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom is having a dinner party at home tonight and she is running all over the place to finish cleaning the house in time. When she goes out to do a round-trip to the bakery, the Triplets decide to give her a hand. But nothing goes as planned: the vacuum cleaner brakes, the couch is stained and the corridor is full of soap. Be careful Mom, the floor is very very slippery!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: An animal and pets magazine is organizing a wonderful contest to win a subscription: you have to send them a picture of your dog and relate its achievements. The Triplets decide to photograph Toto but cannot seem to find what he can do. Would he have what it takes to assist firemen? Policemen? Or detectives? Oh no! Just thinking about it makes Toto tremble with fear. The Triplets must think fast, there are only a few hours left to participate. But suddenly it hits them: of course, Toto is a hug specialist!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy wants to decorate his room with a huge branch that he found lying in the river and which he believes to be very beautiful. But his room is also Scoutbadger’s room and the latter doesnt agree at all. Scoutbadger thinks that this piece of wood isnt pretty at all. Quite the opposite of the pieces of bark that he painted and is very proud of! However, Woodsy thinks that Scoutbadger’s artworks are very ugly…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the theme part and rides his first rollercoaster!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Leo make an erupting volcano for the science fair!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Cleo is shocked to learn snow does not last forever and tries to stop it from melting. But will her mission to save the snow be successful?.

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Eddie and Hodge have cleaned the sludge out of the chugwash. Now they’re going to refill the chugwash soap, then clean the underground tunnels using the Scrub-A-Chug - a fantastic piece of rolling stock with brushes that cleans the ceiling of the tunnel. Their work is interrupted when they get called away on an emergency. Wilson decides to be helpful by finishing their chores. Unfortunately, he accidentally replaces the chugwash soap with chugwash sludge - and when he tries to clean the tunnels with the Scrub-a-Chug, he ends up making an even bigger mess!

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Wilson is given the important job of taking some photos, to be used on a poster promoting Chuggington. Meanwhile, Dr. Ling has a special assignment for Hoot and Toot: pulling a robotic dinosaur around town to promote a new exhibition at the museum. Wilson isn’t having much luck taking exciting pictures - until he sees the dinosaur go by. Wowzer! He has to get a photo of that! He chases after it, but unfortunately has a collision. His camera flies off and lands out of reach - just as Hoot and Toot arrive with the dinosaur. Hoot has an idea. Extending the dinosaur’s neck, and using its jaws to grab, Hoot and Toot reach up and retrieve Wilson’s camera.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley just doesnt get it: everyone accuses him of things hes never done! Until he discovers a little boy on the sports course who looks a lot like him and is a real scoundrel. So hes the one doing the mischief, not Charley! But how do you tell the little rascal to behave?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have some big, tall fun in Hatty’s garden, but who is the tallest? Who is taller than Hatty’s tallest sunflower? Who is the tallest when wearing stilts? And what is the tallest thing they can see? When Tweet says she wants to be the tallest, her friends take her to the top of the tallest mountain - but she gets dizzy and decides she’s happy being the smallest after all.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who reigns over the ocean? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Pirate.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden, while hiking in the Canadian forest, discovers a tree about to fall and rushes to warn an opossum family. The mother opossum and her joeys are endangered as the tree crashes, and three babies end up trapped in an underground burrow. In the Garden, Katie is trying to wake up a sleeping Leo to water the flowers but he ends up waking up to a call from Jayden. Leo, Katie, and Hero rush to the rescue after learning about opossums. They devise a plan involving PlatypusOnes winch, Heros distraction, and Katies grabber to save the trapped joeys. However, the tree proves too heavy, and the winch detaches, leaving one joey stuck. The rangers and Hero unite to push the tree, with unexpected help from Ranger Rocky. They successfully free the last joey who plays possum to their horror but Ranger Joey explains the opossums playing possum behavior and the rangers wait a distance away to give it space and ensure the baby recovers. Eventually, the baby wakes up and gets on its mother, and the grateful family leaves. Back in the garden, Leo is about to water the flowers with Katie but finds her sleeping in his deck chair with Hero.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Dolly leaves for and adventure with Harry Hedgehog, so she asks Bubbles to take care of her flowers while shes gone. Bubble forgets to water them, so they quickly wither. Now Bubble has to find a way to make the flowers bloom again.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The residents of the forest decide to celebrate the last day of the year with music. The ants form a choir, Dr Owl becomes the conductor, and all the little bugs create instruments for themselves. But Iris, the icebeetle loses her bells, so everyone starts to help her find them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Lemon and Raspberry make the final preparations for the contest. Strawberry offers the twins to be models at the contest instead of her. Sweet is delighted, but Sour is not excited. Shortly before the show is broadcast, Sour sabotages the TV equipment.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: In the morning, Rosie discovers that its Grandparents Day,which she had totally forgotten! But Grandpa and Grandma Fox are coming for dinner and she is intent on making a gift for them. She decides to create a show with the help of her sister, her brothers and Edmund. It will be The Three Little Badgers. Alas, nothing goes as Rosie hoped. The show is soon at risk, as Edmund, who was supposed to play the Big Bad Hurricane mustleave to help Casimir fix a collapsed dam.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf.
